title: Transfer results for hybrid logic Part I: the case without satisfaction operators
abstract: We define for every Kripke complete modal logic L its hybrid companion LH and investigate which properties transfer from L to LH. For a specific class of logics, we present a satisfiability-preserving translation from LH to L. We prove that for this class of logics, complexity, (uniform) interpolation, and finite axiomatization transfer from L to LH. We also provide examples showing that, in general, none of complexity, decidability, the finite model property or the Beth property transfer
